panels.description:
### MRs/PRs Throughput 

A count of how many pull requests are merged over a period of time.
panels.title: MRs/PRs Throughput

panels.description:
### MRs/PRs Rates

This is the ratio of product MRs authored by team members in Development Department to the number of team members in the Development Department.
panels.title: MRs/PRs Rates

panels.description:
### MRs/PRs Success Rate

The percentage of opened MRs/PRs closed that are successfully merged.
panels.title: MRs/PRs Success Rate (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### Friday MRs/PRs

Shows the number of MRs/PRs opened on Friday
panels.title: Friday MRs/PRs (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### Unreviewed MRs/PRs

The percentage of pull requests that were merged without review.
panels.title: Unreviewed MRs/PRs (this month)

panels.description:
### MRs/PRs Comments

The sum of the number of comments a user has made on MR/PR
panels.title: MRs/PRs Comments (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### MRs/PRs Participants 

The total amount of participation a user has contributed to MR/PR
panels.title: MRs/PRs Participants (last 30 days)

panels.description: The MR sum that the user self-merged. Only for the current month
panels.title: Self-Merging Users (this month)

panels.description:
### Cycle Time

The time between when the first commit is authored to when a MR/PR is merged.
panels.title: Cycle Time (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### Repository Defect Rate 

The percentage of merged pull requests that address defects.

We determine that a PR is addressing a defect by looking at its title and looking for the presence of a set of keywords, specifically any word that begins with:

* fix
* revert
* bug
* repair

Thus, it will match things like "reverts", "bugfix", "fixes", "repairs" etc. Because we're looking for words that begin with these keywords, we'll match for "fixes", but not "prefix".
panels.title: Repository Defect Rate (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### User Defect Rate


Same calculation method from Repository Defect Rate
panels.title: User Defect Rate (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### Time To Open

The time between the earliest commit in a pull request and when the pull request is opened.

Time to Open includes all MRs/PRs which were opened during the selected time frame. This includes MRs/PRs which were closed, declined, merged, or remain open.
panels.title: Time To Open (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### Time To Review 

The average time between when a pull request is opened and when it received its first review. In calculating the average, each pull request is counted once (not as many times as there are reviewers).
panels.title: Time to Review (last 30 days)

panels.description:
### Time To Merge

The duration between when a pull request is opened and when it is merged.
panels.title: Time to Merge (last 30 days)
